title: Fix Create Bike submission and remove global palette bar (keep BikeForm palette)

requirements.text: Fix the Create Bike flow so that clicking the “Create Bike” submit button successfully creates a new bike entry and the new bike appears in the user’s bike list (Manage Bikes page) instead of showing an “action not available” error.

quotes: when adding all the details, then i click on create bike it saying action not available.
“action not available” after clicking Create Bike. simple the bike should be created. it submit the form and create a new bike entry in your system.

acceptanceCriteria: As an authenticated user on /manage-bikes, filling out the Create New Bike form and submitting results in a successful backend createBike call and returns a bike id.
After successful creation, the Manage Bikes list refreshes and includes the newly created bike without requiring a manual page refresh.
If creation fails (e.g., unauthorized or actor not ready), the UI shows a clear error message explaining the cause (not a generic “action not available”) and does not close the form.

requirements.text: Remove the color-palette detection bar/UI element from the top of the website (global header/top-of-page area), while keeping the AI palette functionality inside the bike creation/edit form (BikeForm) unchanged and available.

quotes: and remove the palette from the top of the website.
The colour-palette detection bar we previously added, but don't need to remove the AI palette we have on the bike form.

acceptanceCriteria: No palette detection bar or palette-related UI is visible in the site-wide header/top-of-page area across pages.
The BikeForm still shows its palette-related functionality (no regression in the bike form palette UI/features).

constraints: Frontend must not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Backend changes must remain within the single Motoko actor (backend/main.mo); only add backend/migration.mo if an actual state migration is required.
nonGoals: Do not remove or redesign the AI palette feature within the BikeForm.
Do not add new authentication providers beyond Internet Identity.
Do not add new bike-related features beyond fixing the create submission and removing the global palette bar.
